pullRequest.title: [iammeter] Iammeter Binding initial contribution
pullRequest.bodyText:
Initial contribution,Add support for Iammeter devices in Openhab.
Iammeter devices provides real-time readings of power meter over Wi-Fi.
The Iammeter binding is make data visualized in openhab system.
this binding had tested locally.
sorry that I closed PR 7799 accidentally and don't know how to open it again,so I opened this PR to continue my progress.
sorry to bother you with this.

afterCommit.message:
First commit for iammeter devices.

Signed-off-by: lewei50 <service@lewei50.com>

nodes.bodyText: What type of exception do you expect here? Can you specify the concrete type?
You should store the ScheduledFuture returned by scheduleWithFixedDelay() to a field, to be able to cancel it in dispose().
Since you specified a delay of 0 sec. when scheduling the runnable above, refresh() is invoked instantly. So, this is invocation of refresh() is redundant and could be removed.
As getConfigAs() is an expensive operation, can you move it to initialize()?
I think the stream must be closed after using it.
You should specify the concrete exception you want to catch, since catching Exception catches also all runtime exceptions.
Do you log the stack trace by intention?
Can you be a bit more specific, that somebody who isn't aware of Iammeter gets a clue what this is about?

+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<binding:binding id="iammeter" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+	xmlns:binding="https://openhab.org/schemas/binding/v1.0.0"

nodes.bodyText: Can this file be removed?

See https://www.openhab.org/docs/concepts/units-of-measurement.html#list-of-units

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		<item-type>Number:V</item-type>
          
          
            
            		<item-type>Number:ElectricPotential</item-type>
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,182 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<thing:thing-descriptions bindingId="iammeter"
+	xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+	xmlns:thing="https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description/v1.0.0"
+	xsi:schemaLocation="https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description/v1.0.0 https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description-1.0.0.xsd">
+
+	<thing-type id="powermeter">
+		<label>Iammeter Power Meter</label>
+		<description>PowerMeter thing for Iammeter Binding</description>
+
+		<channels>
+			<channel id="voltage_a" typeId="voltage_a" />
+			<channel id="current_a" typeId="current_a" />
+			<channel id="power_a" typeId="power_a" />
+			<channel id="importenergy_a" typeId="importenergy_a" />
+			<channel id="exportgrid_a" typeId="exportgrid_a" />
+			<channel id="frequency_a" typeId="frequency_a" />
+			<channel id="pf_a" typeId="pf_a" />
+			<channel id="voltage_b" typeId="voltage_b" />
+			<channel id="current_b" typeId="current_b" />
+			<channel id="power_b" typeId="power_b" />
+			<channel id="importenergy_b" typeId="importenergy_b" />
+			<channel id="exportgrid_b" typeId="exportgrid_b" />
+			<channel id="frequency_b" typeId="frequency_b" />
+			<channel id="pf_b" typeId="pf_b" />
+			<channel id="voltage_c" typeId="voltage_c" />
+			<channel id="current_c" typeId="current_c" />
+			<channel id="power_c" typeId="power_c" />
+			<channel id="importenergy_c" typeId="importenergy_c" />
+			<channel id="exportgrid_c" typeId="exportgrid_c" />
+			<channel id="frequency_c" typeId="frequency_c" />
+			<channel id="pf_c" typeId="pf_c" />
+		</channels>
+
+		<config-description>
+			<parameter name="host" type="text" required="true">
+				<label>Device's IP Address</label>
+				<description>IP address for your device</description>
+				<context>network-address</context>
+				<default>127.0.0.1</default>
+			</parameter>
+			<parameter name="port" type="text" required="true" min="1" max="65535">
+				<label>Device's Port</label>
+				<description>Port</description>
+				<default>80</default>
+			</parameter>
+			<parameter name="refreshInterval" type="text" required="false" unit="s">
+				<label>Refresh Interval</label>
+				<default>60</default>
+			</parameter>
+		</config-description>
+
+	</thing-type>
+
+	<channel-type id="voltage_a">
+		<item-type>Number:V</item-type>

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		<item-type>Number:A</item-type>
          
          
            
            		<item-type>Number:ElectricCurrent</item-type>

+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="current_a">

afterCommit.message:
code formating and justify.

Signed-off-by: lewei50 <service@lewei50.com>

nodes.bodyText: This can be made static. Also it's good practice to append the unit to the field name e.g. TIMEOUT_MS. Please move it to the other fields.
The configuration is only assigned to the local variable. You might want to assign it to the class field.
Is there some implementation missing?

nodes.bodyText: The annotation has no effect since getConfigAs() always returns NonNull and can therefore removed.
See above.

+    IammeterWEM3080TChannel(String id, int r, int c) {
+        this.id = id;
+        this.row = r;
+        this.col = c;
+        this.unit = null;

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change

@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+# Iammeter Binding 
+
+[Iammeter](https://www.iammeter.com) provides real-time readings of single-phase (WEM3080, WEM3162) and three-phase (WEM3080T) meters from IAMMETER over Wi-Fi.
+
+## Use of the binding
+
+The Iammeter is exposed as one thing with a number of channels that can be used to read the values for different aspects of your Iammeter devices. 
+
+## Setup of the binding
+
+You can add the Iammeter device via the openHAB UI manually.
+
+
+## Available channels
+
+The following table is taken from the official manual and contains all available channels.
+
+Single-phase energy meter (WEM3080/WEM3162)
+|Name|Unit|Description|Type|

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+# Iammeter Binding 
+
+[Iammeter](https://www.iammeter.com) provides real-time readings of single-phase (WEM3080, WEM3162) and three-phase (WEM3080T) meters from IAMMETER over Wi-Fi.
+
+## Use of the binding
+
+The Iammeter is exposed as one thing with a number of channels that can be used to read the values for different aspects of your Iammeter devices. 
+
+## Setup of the binding
+
+You can add the Iammeter device via the openHAB UI manually.
+
+
+## Available channels
+
+The following table is taken from the official manual and contains all available channels.
+
+Single-phase energy meter (WEM3080/WEM3162)
+|Name|Unit|Description|Type|
+|----|----|----|----|
+|voltage_a|V|Voltage|Number|
+|current_a|A|Current|Number|
+|power_a|W|Active power|Number|
+|importenergy_a|kWh|Energy consumption from gird|Number|
+|exportgrid_a|kWh|Energy export to grid|Number|
+
+Three-phase energy meter (WEM3080T)
+|Name|Unit|Description|Type|
+|----|----|----|----|
+|voltage_a|V|A phase voltage|Number|
+|current_a|A|A phase current|Number|
+|power_a|W|A phase active power|Number|
+|importenergy_a|kWh|A phase import energy|Number|
+|exportgrid_a|kWh|A phase export energy|Number|
+|frequency_a|kWh|A phase frequency|Number|
+|pf_a|kWh|A phase power factor|Number|
+|voltage_b|V|B phase voltage|Number|
+|current_b|A|B phase current|Number|
+|power_b|W|B phase active power|Number|
+|importenergy_b|kWh|B phase import energy|Number|
+|exportgrid_b|kWh|B phase export energy|Number|
+|frequency_b|kWh|B phase frequency|Number|
+|pf_b|kWh|B phase power factor|Number|
+|voltage_c|V|C phase voltage|Number|
+|current_c|A|C phase current|Number|
+|power_c|W|C phase active power|Number|
+|importenergy_c|kWh|C phase import energy|Number|
+|exportgrid_c|kWh|C phase export energy|Number|
+|frequency_c|kWh|C phase frequency|Number|
+|pf_c|kWh|C phase power factor|Number|
+

nodes.bodyText: This method is called for every channel linked. So if you have 5 items this method is called 5 times. That doesn't seem right. Better to cache the data. You can use the openHAB ExpiringCache. You call the object and if the time has exceeded it will retreive the data. For example I've used it with a 3 seconds timeout.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * @author yangbo - Initial contribution
          
          
            
             * @author Yang Bo - Initial contribution

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            			<parameter name="refreshInterval" type="text" required="false">
          
          
            
            			<parameter name="refreshInterval" type="text" required="false" unit="s">

nodes.bodyText:
You can just create 1 channel type voltage and then specify the label per channel.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            			<channel id="voltage_a" typeId="voltage_a"/>
          
          
            
            			<channel id="voltage_a" typeId="voltage">
          
          
            
            			    <label>Voltage A</label>
          
          
            
            			</channel>
          
      
    
    
  

or maybe even better. Create 3 channel groups, a, b, anc c as all these groups have the same channels.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,180 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<thing:thing-descriptions bindingId="iammeter"
+	xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+	xmlns:thing="https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description/v1.0.0"
+	xsi:schemaLocation="https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description/v1.0.0 https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description-1.0.0.xsd">
+	<thing-type id="powermeter">
+		<label>Iammeter Power Meter</label>
+		<description>PowerMeter thing for Iammeter Binding</description>
+		<channels>
+			<channel id="voltage_a" typeId="voltage_a"/>

nodes.bodyText: This is not right. You should model the different types as different things. So in the xml you would see 2 things, 1 with all channels and 1 with the limited set of channels. You can then create 2 different classes, or maybe create 2 classes that each parse the specific data. and in the handler factory you can than pass that specific class to this handler based on the specific thing created.
Is the user/password configurable? In that case it should be a thing parameter. Also it's better to pass it as a header parameter instead of putting in the url.
In this case the status should probaly also be set to OFFLINE.
You've removed the wrong file 😉 This file is at the root, you removed the file in the binding. That file should not be removed.

nodes.bodyText:
You only need 1 group powerPhaseGroup. And for each group set label and description here:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            			<channel-group id="powerPhaseA" typeId="powerPhaseGroupA" />
          
          
            
            			<channel-group id="powerPhaseA" typeId="powerPhaseGroup" >
          
          
            
            			    <label>Power Phase A</label>
          
          
            
            		            <description>Power phase 1 for Iammeter device</description>
          
          
            
            			</channel-group>

nodes.bodyText: I don't see the updateStatus here. Is it done somewhere else?

Related to the class splitting. I didn't intend for you to completely copy paste the code as it duplicates a lot of code. Better make an abstract base class with all the logic and let it call methods to do the specific code. The code I selected here would be in the sub class. The method would get the response as parameter. You can make the method getDecimal  protected (better rename it getQuantityState probably`.

First commit for iammeter devices.

Signed-off-by: lewei50 <service@lewei50.com>

code formating and justify.

fix format
